item.title: By: will
item.dc:creator: will
item.description: If it's telling you that "map" is not defined it's likely that you have declared it as a local variable to a specific function. Worth making sure that you haven't got "var map = blahblah" but instead "map = blahblah".
item.content:encoded: If it’s telling you that “map” is not defined it’s likely that you have declared it as a local variable to a specific function. Worth making sure that you haven’t got “var map = blahblah” but instead “map = blahblah”.

item.title: By: Jarrod
item.dc:creator: Jarrod
item.description:
Thanks for this tutorial, it has really helped me to get started with JS and google maps.
I'm and running into problems when I try and call the 'addMarker' function from outside of the , I want to call this from within the page body as I loop through a list of address. When I try this I get the following error (using FireFox and Firebug)...
map is not defined [Break On This Error] map.addOverlay(myMarker);
Any ideas?
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for this tutorial, it has really helped me to get started with JS and google maps.

I’m and running into problems when I try and call the ‘addMarker’ function from outside of the , I want to call this from within the page body as I loop through a list of address. When I try this I get the following error (using FireFox and Firebug)…

map is not defined
[Break On This Error] map.addOverlay(myMarker);

Any ideas?
